TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / click the continue button to start the experiment.
A 20ml syringe connected with a cannula is taken from the table and the cap of its needle is removed.
The selected portion of the arm in which blood is taken is wiped with alcohol soaked cotton.
The needle of the cannula is inserted into the patient vein and 20 ml of the blood is taken into the syringe by pulling the plunger.
After collecting the blood to the syringe, The needle of the cannula is removed from the arm
The blood collected area is pressed using a cotton ball to stop the blood flow
The cannula with needle is removed from the syringe
The removed cannula with needle is carefully discarded into the Biohazard box.
A 5ml heparinized green top tube is taken from the test tube rack.
The cap of the heparinized green top tube is opened and 5ml of the blood is added to it. The tube is closed.
The blood is properly mixed by inverting the tube for 3-4 times.
The tube is kept back to the rack
Similarly 5ml of the blood is transferred to the rest of the three tubes in the rack and is mixed properly by inverting each tube for 3-4 times.
First green caped tube is taken from the rack.
The cap of the heparinised tube is opened
50ml of the screw cap tube is taken from the rack
The cap of the screw cap tube is opened and transfers the blood from the heparinised tube to the screw cap tube.
The empty heparinised tube is kept back into the rack.
Similarly all the blood from the heparinised tube is transferred to the 50ml screw cap tube.
The 50ml tube is kept back to the rack and taken out pipette pump.
25ml of glass pipette is connected with a pipette pump.
25ml of glass pipette is connected with a pipette pump.
The cap of the 1X PBS buffer is opened and pipette out 20 ml of PBS Buffer from it.
50ml tube containing blood is taken out from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and transfers 20ml of PBS Buffer to it.
The tube is closed and is kept back to the rack.
4°C freezer is opened and taken out histopaque – 1077 medium from it.
The histopaque – 1077 medium is placed on the work bunch.
10ml of glass pipette is taken from the rack.
And is connected with pipette pump.
The histopaque – 1077 medium is opened and pipette out 10ml from it.
50ml of a screw cap tube is taken from the rack.
10ml of histopaque – 1077 medium is transferred to the tube.
The tube is kept back to the rack.
The histopaque – 1077 medium is taken from the table.
4°C freezer is opened and kept back histopaque – 1077 medium to it.
25ml glass pipette is taken from the rack.
And is connected with a pipette pump.
Diluted blood containing tube is taken from the rack.
notext
The tube is replaced into the rack and taken out the histopaque – 1077 medium containing tube.
The tube is opened and 20ml of diluted blood is transferred to it.
Refrigerated centrifuge tube is opened and the tube is inserted on the slot of the centrifuge. Also placed another tube on the opposite slot for balancing.
Refrigerated centrifuge tube is opened and the tube is inserted on the slot of the centrifuge. Also placed another tube on the opposite slot for balancing.
The centrifuge tube is closed.
The tube is centrifuged at 1800rpm for 30 minutes at 4°C.
After 30 minutes, the centrifuge tube is opened.
The tube is taken from the centrifuge tube.
The centrifuge tube is closed.
The tube is placed on the rack. After centrifugation the solution has three layers.
10ml glass pipette is taken from the rack.
And is connected with a pipette pump.
The tube is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and the supernatant layer is carefully taken from it.
The tube is replaced in the rack.
The supernatant layer is discarded into the waste beaker.
5000 micro liter micropipette is taken from the rack.
notext
A fresh tip is inserted into it.
The tube is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and Buffy coat layer is carefully pipette from it.
The tube is replaced in the rack and a new 50ml centrifuge tube is taken from the rack.
Open the tube and Buffy coat layer is transferred in to it.
The tube is replaced in the rack.
1X PBS Buffer containing bottle is opened and 40ml buffer is transferred into 50ml measuring cylinder.
The tube containing buffy coat layer is taken from the rack.
The tube is opened and PBS Buffer in the measuring cylinder is added to it.
The tube is closed and the solution in the tube is mixed well by inverting the tube for 3-4 times.
The centrifuge is opened.
The tube is inserted on the slot of the centrifuge. Also placed another tube on the opposite slot for balancing.
The centrifuge tube is closed.
The tube is centrifuged at 1800rpm for 10 minutes at 4°C.
After 10 minutes, the centrifuge is opened.
The tube is taken from the centrifuge tube.
The tube is replaced in the rack.
25ml glass pipette is taken from the rack.
And is connected to a pipette pump.
The centrifuged tube is taken from the rack.
The tube is opened and supernatant is carefully pipette out from it.
The tube is replaced into the rack.
The supernatant layer is discarded into the waste beaker.
The pipette is removed from the pipette pump.
A 10ml glass pipette is taken from the rack.
And is connected with the pipette pump.
1X PBS buffer containing bottle is opened and 10ml of buffer is pipetted out from it.
The centrifuged tube taken from the rack.
The tube is opened and the PBS buffer is added to it.
The tube is closed and the solution in the tube is mixed by inverting the tube for 3-4 times.
The centrifuge is opened.
The tube is inserted on the slot of the centrifuge. Also placed another tube on the opposite slot for balancing.
The centrifuge tube is closed.
The tube is centrifuged at 1500rpm for 10 minutes at 4°C.
After 10 minutes, the centrifuge is opened.
The tube is taken from the centrifuge tube.
The tube is replaced in the rack.
25ml glass pipette is taken from the rack.
And is connected to a pipette pump.
The centrifuged tube is taken from the rack.
The tube is opened and supernatent is carefully pipette out from it.
The tube is replaced into the rack.
The supernatant is discarded into the waste beaker.
4°C freezer is opened and taken out freezing medium from it.
The freezing medium is placed on the work bunch and 5000 micro liter micropipette is taken from the rack.
The value of micropipette is 5000 micro liter.
A new tip is inserted into the micropipette.
The freezing medium is opened and pipette out 5000 micro liter from it.
The centrifuged tube containing pellet is taken from the rack.
The tube is opened and 5000 micro liter of freezing medium is transferred to the tube. The pellet is resuspended into the medium by pipetting it for 3-4 times.
The tube is kept back to the rack.
4°C freezer is opened and kept back freezing medium to it.
The pipette tip is discarded into a waste beaker.
The micropipette value is adjusted to 1000 micro liter.
A new tip is inserted into the micropipette.
The tube containing resuspended pellet is taken from the rack.
The tube is opened and 1000 micro liter of resuspended pellet is pipette from it.
The tube is replaced in the rack.
A cryovial is taken from the rack.
The cryovial is opened and 1ml of resuspended pellet is transferred to it.
The closed cryovial is kept back to the rack. Another cryovial is taken from the rack.
Similarly 1000 micro liter of resuspended pellet is transferred to the remaining cryovials.
The cryobox is opened and all cryovials are placed in it. The cryobox is closed.
A -80°C freezer is opened and the cryobox is placed in it. The cryobox is stored at -80°C for 24hours.
After 24 hours, The -80°C freezer is closed and the cryobox containing vials is taken from it. The freezer is closed.
The liquid nitrogen cryofreezer is opened; the cryobox is placed in it and is stored for long time.
